result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Alonzo Harmon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William Alonzo Harmon appeared by video.  Attorney Ethan M. Padway appeared by video for William Alonzo Harmon.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested a scheduling conference. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Appointing Attorney at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant William Alonzo Harmon in court.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for pretrial conference.  Atty. Ethan Padway is appointed on defendant's other case.  Court appoints Ethan Padway as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Padway accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 10/01/22 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Due to lower pending case, this matter is transferred to Judge Davila, Br. 1.  Pretrial conference scheduled for 9/07/22 at 10:00.  rmm
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/13/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KDM.

Defendant William Alonzo Harmon in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant may qualify for Public Defender representation. Defendant declined to be interviewed. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/11/2022@2pm
